channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘We’ll see if I can hold my nose and approve it’: Judge hates $1.5b AI settlement with book authors so much he’s taking 2 weeks to think it over
item.description: After spending nearly an hour mostly lambasting Anthropic's settlement, Judge William Alsup scheduled another hearing on September 25.

item.title: A Woman Is Murdered, And The Media Rush To Defend Democrats By Calling It ‘Political’
item.description: The media are so opposed to everything Trump does they're willing to watch people die.

item.title: Jury pool shrinks as Ryan Routh trial unfolds in Florida on Day 2
item.description: Judge Aileen Cannon removed potential jurors for Ryan Routh's assassination attempt trial, including a woman who declared herself 'MAGA.'

item.title: Can New Yorkers Unite Against Mamdani?
item.description: The stars are aligned against a unified front to stop a radical takeover of America’s greatest city.

item.title: How Long Will We Tolerate the Madness in Our Streets?

item.title: Trump says Princeton student Elizabeth Tsurkov freed after being held by Hezbollah for 2 years
item.description: President Donald Trump announces Princeton student Elizabeth Tsurkov has been released by Hezbollah and is now safe at the American Embassy in Iraq.

item.title: Target was hoping for a back-to-school sales bump that never game. Foot traffic is still down for the 7th month in a row
item.description: In August, foot traffic fell 3.3% year over year for Target.

item.title: I Need to Stop Watching These ‘Ballerina’ Movies
item.description: Why are the assassins learning to dance in this year’s John Wick spin-off? It’s not really clear.

item.title: Free Abortions And No Prisons: 6 Craziest Beliefs Of The Socialist Faction Infiltrating The Democrat Party
item.description: Democrats who embrace rotten DSA policies festering in their party are paving the way for a nation that would make our founders weep.

item.title: Tylenol maker’s stock lost billions after a rumor linking the medicine to autism. Wall Street says buy the dip as one bank sees a ‘major overreaction’
item.description: Canaccord Genuity went on social media to gauge the reaction. Even the MAHA crowd was mixed on this one.

item.title: Tesla bull Dan Ives now chairs a company hoarding a Sam Altman-linked cryptocurrency. He’s not the only big name to enter the treasury race
item.description: Digital asset treasury companies increasingly turn to Wall Street celebrities to stand out in a crowded field.

item.title: White House criticizes Israel for attacking Hamas leaders in Doha, citing Qatari-U.S. friendship
item.description: President Trump is upset with Israel for bombing Hamas leaders within Qatar, a key U.S. ally, according to the White House.

item.title: Appeals Court Upholds $83.3M Judgment Against Trump for Defaming E. Jean Carroll
item.description: While there are reasons to be skeptical of Carroll’s claims, Trump has himself to blame for the legal blunders that led to the astonishing outcome.

item.title: Just 6% Of Female Gen Z Harris Voters Think Personal Success Includes Having Kids
item.description: It’s no secret that fewer and fewer Americans are having children. Gen Z women, especially, do not see children as a big measure of success.

item.title: House Speaker Mike Johnson calls for 'old-school' House-Senate conference for spending negotiations
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson on Tuesday laid out his key demand for government funding negotiations: Spend less.

item.description: What started as ordinary tech sales to China became the foundation of a sweeping surveillance machine, powered by U.S. companies.
